DOC.HEAD: Twenty-First Victim of Blast Identified
DOC.TEXT: Medical examiners have identified the 21st victim of the October explosion that rocked the Phillips Petroleum Co. plastics plant, Phillips officials said Friday. Ruben Alamillo, 35, of Houston, had worked at the plant for 11 years, Phillips spokesman Bill Wicker said. Twenty-three people are believed to have died in the Oct. 23 blast. Two people are unaccounted for although the 22nd fatality is confirmed but not identified, Wicker said. The search at the plant site as well as an investigation of the accident is continuing, he said.
